lines.content: Bron is a chatbot designed to help you manage your tasks efficiently with simple commands.
From adding to-do tasks, deadlines, and events to managing them, Bron has you covered.
1. Ensure Java 17 or above is installed on your system.
2. Download the latest .jar file from the repository.
3. Copy the .jar file to your preferred folder.
4. Open a terminal in the folder and run the command:
ℹ️ **Note:** Commands are case-insensitive, and extra spaces between parameters will be ignored.
**Description:** Displays a guide on how to use Bron and its features.
**Description:** Adds a to-do task to your list.
adds “Buy groceries” to your task list.
**Description:** Adds a deadline task with a specified due date and time.
adds “Submit assignment” with the due date of October 12, 2024, 6:00 PM.
**Description:** Adds an event to your list with start and end times.
adds "Project meeting" event with the timeline from October 12, 2024, 9:00AM to October 12, 2024, 11:00AM.
**Description:** Lists all tasks currently in your task list.
**Description:** Searches and lists tasks containing the specified keyword.
displays all tasks that contain the word “groceries”.
**Description:** Marks the specified task as completed.
marks the first task in the list as done.
**Description:** Unmarks the specified task, indicating it is not completed.
**Description:** Deletes the specified task from your list.
- Your tasks are automatically saved after each command.
- Tasks are loaded from the saved file when you restart Bron.
* The entry point for the Bron chatbot application.
* Initializes the storage, task list, and command processor, then starts the chatbot.
* The main method that serves as the entry point for the Bron chatbot.
* Loads tasks from storage, initializes the command processor, and starts the chatbot.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* Handles the execution of commands and interacts with the TaskList and FileStorage.
* It provides methods for various commands such as adding tasks, marking tasks, and finding tasks.
* Constructs a CommandHandler with the given TaskList and FileStorage.
* @param storage The FileStorage for saving and loading tasks.
* Processes the given command and line. Delegates to the appropriate handler method based on the command.
* @param line The full user input line.
public void handleCommand(Command command, String line) {
* Handles the help command by calling the TextUI to display help.

* @param line The full user input line containing the keyword.
* @throws EmptyKeywordException If no keyword is provided.
private void handleFind(String line) throws EmptyKeywordException {
System.out.println("No tasks found with the keyword: " + keyword);
System.out.println("Here are the tasks that have the keyword: " + keyword);
* Displays the goodbye message to the user.

* Handles the "list" command, displaying the current tasks.
System.out.printf("You have %d tasks in your list.%n", taskList.size());

private void deleteTask(int index) throws TaskIndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Handles the "mark" command, marking a task as done.

* @throws TaskIndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of bounds.
private void handleMark(int index) throws TaskIndexOutOfBoundsException {
System.out.println("Good shit kid! I've marked this task as done:");
* Handles the "unmark" command, marking a task as not done.

private void handleUnmark(int index) throws TaskIndexOutOfBoundsException {
System.out.println("Get yo shit together son, this task aint done yet:");
* Handles the "todo" command, adding a ToDo task.
* @param line The full user input line containing the task description.
* @throws EmptyTodoDescriptionException If the description is missing.
private void handleTodo(String line) throws EmptyTodoDescriptionException {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Handles the "deadline" command, adding a Deadline task with a date.
* @param line The full user input line containing the task description and deadline.
* @throws InvalidDeadlineFormatException If the format is invalid.
private void handleDeadline(String line) throws InvalidDeadlineFormatException {
throw new InvalidDeadlineFormatException("The deadline must include '/by' followed by the date.");
throw new InvalidDeadlineFormatException("Please provide a valid deadline after '/by'.");
throw new InvalidDeadlineFormatException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new InvalidDeadlineFormatException("Invalid date format! Please use yyyy-MM-dd HHmm.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Handles the "event" command, adding an Event task with a start and end time.
* @param line The full user input line containing the task description and event timings.
* @throws InvalidEventFormatException If the format is invalid.
private void handleEvent(String line) throws InvalidEventFormatException {
throw new InvalidEventFormatException("The event must include '/from' and '/to' to specify the time.");
throw new InvalidEventFormatException("Please provide valid event timings after '/from' and '/to'.");
throw new InvalidEventFormatException("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new InvalidEventFormatException("Please provide valid start and end times.");
Event event = new Event(taskDescription, fromTime, toTime);
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Manages the main command processing flow for the chatbot.
* It handles user input, delegates command execution to the CommandHandler, and interacts with the user interface.
* Constructs a CommandProcessor object with the given TaskList and FileStorage.
* @param taskList The TaskList to process commands for.
* @param storage The FileStorage used for saving and loading tasks.
* Starts the command processing loop, which continues until the user inputs the "bye" command.
* It reads user input, parses the command, and delegates execution to the CommandHandler.
super("The description of a 'todo' cannot be empty.");
super("The command entered is not recognized.");
super("Bron.task.Task index provided is out of bounds.");
* The Parser class provides utility methods to parse various inputs such as commands and task data.
* It also includes methods to parse deadlines and reconstruct tasks from file data.
* Parses a date-time string into a LocalDateTime object.
* @param dateTimeStr the date-time string in the format yyyy-MM-dd HHmm
* @return a LocalDateTime object representing the parsed date and time
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the date-time string is not in the correct format
public static LocalDateTime parseDeadline(String dateTimeStr) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Parses a string representing a task and converts it into the corresponding Task object.
* @param line the string to be parsed, expected to be in the format saved in the file
* @return a Task object (ToDo, Deadline, or Event) based on the parsed data, or null if an error occurs
System.out.println("Error parsing Deadline task (too few parts): " + line);
System.out.println("Invalid date format for Deadline task: " + by);
System.out.println("Error parsing Event task (too few parts): " + line);
return new Event(description, from, to, isDone);
* Parses a user input string and returns the corresponding Command enum.
* @return the parsed Command, or Command.UNKNOWN if the input is not a valid command
String commandStr = parts[0].toLowerCase();  // Extract the first word as command
return Command.UNKNOWN;  // Return UNKNOWN if invalid command
* Handles the loading and saving of tasks to and from a file.
* Supports loading tasks from a file at startup and saving tasks to the file when changes are made.
* The file path is hardcoded as './storage/data.txt'.
* Loads tasks from the specified data file and returns them as a TaskList.
* If the file does not exist, an empty TaskList is returned.
* @return A TaskList containing tasks loaded from the file, or an empty TaskList if the file doesn't exist.
System.out.println("No existing task file found, starting with an empty task list.");
System.out.println("An error occurred while loading tasks.");
* Saves the given TaskList to the file.
* If the necessary directory does not exist, it is created before saving.
* @param taskList The TaskList to save to the file.
System.out.println("Failed to create directory for saving tasks.");
Task task = taskList.getTask(i);  // Access task using TaskList
System.out.println("An error occurred while saving tasks.");
* Represents a task with a deadline. A deadline has a description, a status, and a due date.
* Constructs a new Deadline with the given description and due date.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The due date and time of the deadline.
* Constructs a new Deadline with the given description, due date, and completion status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The due date and time of the deadline.
* @param isDone Whether the task is done.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDateTime by, Boolean isDone) {
* Returns the due date formatted for display purposes.
* @return A formatted string of the due date.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* Returns the task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the task in save format.
* Returns the task type for Deadline.
* Represents an Event task. An Event task has a description, start time, end time, and a status indicating whether it is done or not.
* Constructs a new Event with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
* @param isDone Whether the task is done.
public Event(String description, String from, String to, Boolean isDone) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* @return A string representing the Event task.
* Returns the task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the task in save format.
* Returns the task type for Event.
* Represents a task. A task has a description and a status indicating whether it is done or not.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task. "X" for done, " " for not done.
return (this.isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return A string representing the task, including its status and description.
* Returns the task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the task in save format.
* Returns the type of the task.
* This method is abstract and must be implemented by child classes to return the appropriate task type.
* @return A string representing the task type.

* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize the TaskList with.
* Gets the task at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
public Task getTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {

* Finds and returns a list of tasks that contain the specified keyword.

public void deleteTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {

* Constructs a new ToDo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Constructs a new ToDo task with the given description and completion status.

* Handles the user interface for the chatbot.
* Provides methods to display messages and read user commands.
* Constructs a new TextUI object and initializes the scanner for reading input.
* Displays the introductory message when the chatbot starts.
* Includes the logo and greeting message.
System.out.println(LOGO + "Hello! I'm Bron\n" + "What can I do for you?\n");
* Prompts the user to enter a command and reads the command input from the user.
* @return The command entered by the user.
* Displays the goodbye message when the chatbot ends.
public static void showByeMessage() { System.out.println("Catch you on the flip cuh"); }
* Displays a help message outlining all available commands and their usage.
* This method provides detailed explanations and examples for each command that the chatbot can execute.
System.out.println("Here are the available commands and their usage:");
System.out.println("1. todo [task description] - Adds a to-do task to your list.");
System.out.println("2. deadline [task description] /by [yyyy-MM-dd HHmm] - Adds a deadline task with a specific date and time.");
System.out.println("3. event [task description] /from [start time] /to [end time] - Adds an event task with start and end times.");
System.out.println("4. list - Lists all tasks in your task list.");
System.out.println("5. mark [task number] - Marks the specified task as done.");
System.out.println("6. unmark [task number] - Marks the specified task as not done.");
System.out.println("7. delete [task number] - Deletes the specified task from the list.");
System.out.println("8. find [keyword] - Finds all tasks containing the specified keyword.");
System.out.println("9. help - Displays this help message.");
* Closes the scanner and releases any resources associated with it.
